title: King to strip Andrew of his final military title, minister says
byline: The government is “working to remove” Andrew Mountbatten Windsor’s last honorary military title at the King’s request, the defence secretary has said.

title: Mainly fair weather expected to prevail today
byline: Showers or thundershowers may occur at a few places in Sabaragamuwa, Central and Uva provinces after 2.00 p.m, today (03), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: 10 arrested in Kilinochchi for obstructing STF officers
byline: Five men and five women have been arrested for obstructing a group of Kilinochchi Police Special Task Force (STF) officers during a raid on an illegal alcohol operation in the Sudalakulam area of the Ramanathapuram Police Division, injuring two officers and freeing a suspect.

title: Magnitude 6.3 earthquake shakes Afghanistan’s Mazar-e Sharif city, casualties feared
byline: An earthquake of magnitude 6.3 struck near one of Afghanistan’s largest cities Mazar-e Sharif early on Monday, the U.S. Geological Survey said.

title: India crowned ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup champions
byline: India’s agonising wait for a maiden Women’s World Cup title finally came to an end as Harmanpreet Kaur and her teary-eyed teammates clinched the trophy by beating South Africa in a dramatic final at the DY Patil Stadium on Sunday.

title: One dead in motorcycle-car collision in Kitulgala
byline: A motorcyclist has reportedly died in a road accident near the 39th-kilometre post on the Hatton–Kitulgala road, in the Kitulgala Police Division.

title: Tuition classes targeting 2025 A/L exams prohibited from midnight tomorrow
byline: The 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) Examination is scheduled to commence on November 10 and continue until December 5, the Commissioner General of Examinations, A. K. S. Indika Kumari Liyanage, said.

title: Two arrested for verbally abusing and threatening female Buddhist monk
byline: Two suspects have been arrested by Wattala Police for allegedly engaging in disorderly conduct in a public place in connection with an incident in which a female Buddhist monk was threatened and verbally abused.

title: Trump says China, other countries can’t have Nvidia’s top AI chips
byline: Artificial intelligence giant Nvidia’s most advanced chips will be reserved for U.S. companies and kept out of China and other countries, U.S. President Donald Trump said.

title: ‘Wana Surakuma’ joint operations unit to be established today
byline: The Ministry of Environment announced that the ‘Wana Surakuma’ Joint Operations Unit will be inaugurated today (03), with the objective of conserving Sri Lanka’s natural forest resources.

title: 16 killed, 8 injured as truck crashes into bus in India
byline: At least 16 people were killed and eight others suffered injuries when a tipper lorry carrying gravel collided head-on with a public transport bus in this district on Monday, police said.
